alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 10:49AM CST until March 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing affecting Phillips, Tunica, Lee and Coahoma Counties. ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville affecting Pemiscot, New Madrid and Lake Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY, MARCH 10... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday, March 10. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, In Mississippi, the river is touching the levee at many places near Mhoon Landing. Road to Stubb`s Island is closed. Fields are flooding inside the levee west of Seabrook Road. Water has reached the outlot of McKinney Bayou Pumping Station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.0 feet Thursday, March 03. - Action stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM CST.
